#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Test a Dog 's Intelligence
#Text=In animal intelligence research , even defining the subject of study can be difficult .
#Text=Many basic questions remain unanswered , and people argue endlessly over what the results of tests mean .
#Text=So remember , if your dog scores low , you can still say he 's the smartest dog in the world .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Intelligence Tests
#Text=Find a stopwatch .
#Text=You 'll need a clock that measures seconds for these tests .
#Text=They 're intended to measure problem-solving and adaptation to the environment .
#Text=Toss a towel over the dog 's head .
#Text=Let the dog smell a large towel or a small blanket .
#Text=Toss it over the the dog 's head , covering it completely .
#Text=Start the stopwatch and see how long it takes your dog to get free .
#Text=Write down the score :
#Text=30 seconds or less :
#Text=3 points
#Text=31 – 120 seconds :
#Text=2 points
#Text=Tries but does n't succeed within 120 seconds : 1 point — and take off the towel for him !
#Text=Does n't try to get free : 0 points .
#Text=You might want to practice tossing the towel over a chair beforehand .
#Text=It should land in one , smooth motion .
#Text=Hide a treat under the towel .
#Text=Show the dog a treat .
#Text=While the dog is watching , put the treat on the floor .
#Text=Lay the towel over it .
#Text=Start the stopwatch and see how long the dog takes to reach the treat :
#Text=30 seconds or less :
#Text=3 points
#Text=31 – 60 seconds :
#Text=2 points
#Text=Tries but fails within 60 seconds :
#Text=1 point
#Text=Does n't try :
#Text=0 points
#Text=Set up a low opening .
#Text=For this test , you need a gap low to the ground , that the dog can reach with its paws but not its muzzle .
#Text=A couch might work , or you might need to make one yourself out of a pair of books and a wide plank .
#Text=Weigh down the top of the plank so the dog ca n't easily knock it over .
#Text=Test the dog with the puzzle .
#Text=Place a treat underneath the plank or couch , while the dog is watching .
#Text=Push it far enough underneath that the dog ca n't reach it with its muzzle .
#Text=Encourage the dog to get the treat while you time it :
#Text=Succeeds within 2 minutes ( using its paws ) :
#Text=4 points
#Text=Succeeds within 3 minutes ( using its paws ) :
#Text=3 points
#Text=Fails within 3 minutes , but uses its paws :
#Text=2 points
#Text=Fails , only uses its muzzle : 1 point
#Text=Does n't try : 0 points
#Text=Teach your dog to find a hidden treat .
#Text=The next test is designed to challenge the dog 's memory , not its problem-solving skills .
#Text=To do this , the dog needs to understand what 's going on .
#Text=Put a treat underneath a plastic cup , then tell the dog to find it .
#Text=Lift the cup to show the dog where it is .
#Text=Do this about eight or ten times , until the dog learns that treats go underneath cups .
#Text=Test the dog 's memory .
#Text=Place three plastic buckets or cups upside down on the floor , a foot apart .
#Text=Put a treat underneath one of the cups , while the dog is watching .
#Text=Lead the dog out of the room for 30 seconds , then back .
#Text=Urge the dog to find the treat .
#Text=Checks under the right cup on the first try : 2 points
#Text=Finds it
#Text=within two minutes :
#Text=1 point
#Text=Does n't find it :
#Text=0 points
#Text=Score the dog 's results .
#Text=Add up all your dog 's points and see how it did :
#Text=11 – 12 points : Canine Genius
#Text=8 – 10 points : Obedience School Honor Student
#Text=4 – 7 points : Just an Average
#Text=Rex
#Text=1 – 3
#Text=points :
#Text=I 'm a Barker , Not a Thinker
#Text=0 points :
#Text=You might have just tested a mop .
#Text=Getting Better Results
#Text=Treat it like a game .
#Text=This is no time to be an impartial observer , your dog 's college admissions are on the line !
#Text=But seriously , if the dog is n't interested , she wo n't even try to complete the challenges .
#Text=Encourage the dog with gestures or smiles , keeping it interested but not so excited it forgets what to do .
#Text=Pick a special treat .
#Text=The dog has to cooperate to be tested .
#Text=Pick a special , smelly treat to bribe it with .
#Text=Soft , smelly treats are best , since the dog will notice them and eat them quickly .
#Text=Cut them into small , pea-sized pieces if you plan to do all of these tests at once .
#Text=Pieces of hot dog , cooked chicken , or cheese are all good options .
#Text=Use a dry , non-smelly treat when you 're testing memory .
#Text=Have the dog 's owner conduct the test .
#Text=This test works best if the dog spends a lot of time with the person testing him .
#Text=A dog might not live up to its full potential if it 's been living with the test-giver for less than three months .
#Text=Test a puppy again after it matures .
#Text=A puppy under one year old probably wo n't be as " smart " or obedient as an adult dog .
#Text=Train the dog with treasure hunts .
#Text=Tell the dog to stay while it watches you " hide " a treat in a box or under a table .
#Text=Once it finds the treat , hide the next one in a harder to find location .
#Text=As your dog gets better at this , you can hide the treat while the dog is n't looking , and put it behind several barriers .
#Text=Teach the " new trick " command .
#Text=This is a great way to challenge your dog .
#Text=It works best if you 've clicker trained your dog with several tricks already .
#Text=Use the clicker and say " new trick , " then reward it for any trick it does .
#Text=Repeat immediately with another " new trick " and only reward it if it does something new .
#Text=Keep going until the dog runs out of tricks or gets confused .
#Text=Get brain-testing puzzle toys for your dog .
#Text=You ca n't always be around to tutor your dog .
#Text=Give it some homework in the form of an interactive dog toy .
#Text=These have treats hidden inside that wo n't fall out unless the dog solves a puzzle .
#Text=Some of them even have an electronic voice to give commands , although be careful giving those to dogs with a constant chewing habit .
#Text=Tips
#Text=You can find dog intelligence games online or on mobile devices , for you and your dog to play together .
#Text=Do n't get frustrated if your dog ca n't do it at first .
#Text=Keep working on it !
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Only
#Text=use a light blanket that the dog can easily move under .
#Text=Do n't suffocate a puppy or small dog with a heavy quilt .
#Text=Things
#Text=You 'll Need
#Text=A dog
#Text=A stopwatch
#Text=A blanket or towel
#Text=Treats or a toy
#Text=3 buckets or cups - preferably matching .
#Text=Quick Summary
